label: Accumbens_L_HO50
Description: The NA was defined using the Harvard-Oxford atlas thresholded at a 50% probability (Desikan et al., 2006).

label: Accumbens_R_HO50
Description: The NA was defined using the Harvard-Oxford atlas thresholded at a 50% probability (Desikan et al., 2006).

label: Amygdala_L_HO50
Description: The amygdala was defined using the Harvard-Oxford atlas thresholded at a 50% probability (Desikan et al., 2006).

label: Amygdala_R_HO50
Description: The amygdala was defined using the Harvard-Oxford atlas thresholded at a 50% probability (Desikan et al., 2006).

label: BNST_3t_L_90
Description: The BNST was defined using a mask previously created my our group using an ultra-high field (7T) MRI and a specialized GRASE sequence to trace the BNST (Avery et al., 2014). To ensure the BNST was engaged during the task, whole brain activation was examined.

label: BNST_3t_R_90
Description: The BNST was defined using a mask previously created my our group using an ultra-high field (7T) MRI and a specialized GRASE sequence to trace the BNST (Avery et al., 2014). To ensure the BNST was engaged during the task, whole brain activation was examined.

label: Hippocampus_Ant_L_HO
Description: The anterior hippocampus was defined using the Harvard-Oxford atlas thresholded at a 50% probability (Desikan et al., 2006) using the additional boundary of the uncus to identify the anterior hippocampus.

label: Hippocampus_Ant_R_HO
Description: The anterior hippocampus was defined using the Harvard-Oxford atlas thresholded at a 50% probability (Desikan et al., 2006) using the additional boundary of the uncus to identify the anterior hippocampus.

label: Hypothalamus_L
Description: The hypothalamus mask was created based on the Mai atlas using methods similar to those for the BNST (Avery et al., 2014).

label: Hypothalamus_R
Description: The hypothalamus mask was created based on the Mai atlas using methods similar to those for the BNST (Avery et al., 2014).

label: Insula_anterior_left
Description: The anterior insula was defined using a mask developed by Farb (2013) that has previously been used by our group to demonstrate anterior insula structural connectivity with the BNST (Flook et al., 2020)

label: Insula_anterior_right
Description: The anterior insula was defined using a mask developed by Farb (2013) that has previously been used by our group to demonstrate anterior insula structural connectivity with the BNST (Flook et al., 2020)

label: vmPFC
Description: The vmPFC mask was defined based on a 10mm sphere surrounding the peak point of vmPFC-BNST connectivity from a previous study [x = 0, y = 43, z = -9] (Avery et al., 2014).
